macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Kotak Bank Reports Negative Monthly Returns Amid Market Stability
items.summary: Kotak Bank is trading at Rs 429.50 with daily gains of 0.61% and weekly returns of 0.82%, though the stock has reported negative returns for the month. The bank exhibits a six-month beta of 0.9076, indicating relative stability in performance.

items.title: US Dollar Index (DXY) Declines Slightly to 99.109
items.summary: The US Dollar Index stood at approximately 99.109 as of January 19, 2026, down slightly for the day, reflecting modest weakness in the dollar.

items.title: Cryptocurrency Markets Face Risk-Off Pressure with Ethereum Leading Liquidations
items.summary: Ethereum-led crypto liquidations overtook Bitcoin as macro headwinds pressured the market. Solana fell 0.2% to $133.48, XRP rose 0.3% to $1.97, BNB gained 0.6% to $928.60, and ADA rose 0.3% to $0.366, with retail sentiment turning increasingly bearish.

items.title: Goldman Sachs Predicts Unprecedented IPO 'Mega-Cycle' in 2026
items.summary: Goldman Sachs investment banking co-head Kim Posnett forecasts an IPO mega-cycle with unprecedented deal volume and sizes, driven by major private tech companies with Fortune 500-scale valuations entering public markets. The 10 largest private tech companies are now valued at $3 trillion, up from $300 billion in 2018.

items.title: Global M&A Market Transitions to Bold Growth Phase
items.summary: The global M&A market achieved $5.1 trillion in volume during 2025, representing 44% year-over-year growth, signaling a transition from recovery to a more aggressive deal-making environment in 2026.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Faces Short-Term Bearish Pressure, Forecast to Test 93,865 Resistance Before Potential Decline to 88,405
items.summary: BTC/USD is trading at 93,036 within a descending channel, with moving averages signaling a bearish trend and sellers in control. Analysts predict a correction testing resistance near 93,865 followed by a drop below 88,405 unless it breaks 95,505.

items.title: XRP Surges 20% in First Week of January, Emerges as Top Altcoin to Watch for 2026
items.summary: Ripple's XRP token rose over 20% during the first week of January, briefly nearing the top ranks behind Tether and showing strong upward momentum. Analysts highlight it as a breakout contender over Bitcoin and Ether for the 2026 rally.

items.title: Analyst Forecasts 55% Bitcoin Surge in 2026 Despite Warnings on Crypto Treasuries
items.summary: Standard Chartered's Geoffrey Kendrick predicts Bitcoin could rise 55% this year to around $150,000, driven by spot ETFs and pro-crypto policies under Trump, though buying by digital asset treasury firms is likely over. BTC recently hit $97,538 on Jan. 15 before easing to $93,216 amid tariff threats.

items.title: $2.17B Inflows into Crypto Led by Bitcoin's $1.55B, But Geopolitics Cause Sudden Reversal
items.summary: Crypto saw $2.17 billion in inflows dominated by Bitcoin, fueled by early-week optimism, but gains reversed due to Greenland tensions, Trump tariff threats on Europe, and shifting US Fed expectations.

items.title: Debate Rages: Is Bitcoin Entering a Bear Market After 36% Drop from Peak?
items.summary: Bitcoin has fallen 36% from its recent high, sparking bear market talk on social media, with traders analyzing if January 20 marks a turning point amid ongoing volatility.

items.title: Starknet Hosts Bitcoin Open-Source Talk on Public Infrastructure and Grants
items.summary: Starknet team will host a live discussion at 5 PM UTC with HRF, OpenSats, and StarkWare on Bitcoin's public infrastructure, 2025 grants, and cultural threats.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: NVIDIA Unveils Vera Rubin AI Platform
items.summary: NVIDIA announced its new Vera Rubin AI platform in January 2026, integrating advanced GPU, CPU, DPU, and networking silicon to accelerate deep learning training and inference with higher performance and efficiency.

items.title: MoST: New Open-Source Multimodal LLM for Speech and Text
items.summary: Researchers introduced MoST (Mixture of Speech and Text), the first fully open-source speech-text LLM using Modality-Aware Mixture of Experts (MAMoE), outperforming comparable models on ASR, TTS, and spoken QA benchmarks.

items.title: MCML Researchers Contribute 9 Papers to AAAI 2026
items.summary: MCML announced 9 accepted papers (6 main track, 3 workshops) to AAAI 2026, covering topics like adversarial unlearning for multimodal LLMs, uncertainty quantification, and brain-like thinking in LLMs.

items.title: 2026 Corporate AI Outlook Study Released
items.summary: AI Leaders Council released its 2026 Corporate AI Outlook Study, showing organizations prioritizing workforce productivity and efficiency, with most in early AI deployment phases; preview webcast on January 20.

items.title: AI Detects Rise in Global Floating Algae
items.summary: Scientists used a deep-learning model trained on 1.2 million satellite images to discover increasing floating algae across global oceans over 20 years.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: MIO: Memories in Orbit Launches on January 20
items.summary: The sci-fi Metroidvania adventure MIO: Memories in Orbit, featuring exploration in a labyrinthine spaceship with pastel environments, releases today on multiple platforms. A demo is available, drawing comparisons to narrative-driven indies like Journey.

items.title: Blightstone Releases with Roguelike Action Today
items.summary: Blightstone, a fast-paced action RPG with randomized dungeons, challenging combat, and character upgrades, launches on January 20 alongside other titles.

items.title: Loan Shark Psychological Horror Hits PS5 Today
items.summary: Indie developer Studio Ortica announces Loan Shark, an atmospheric psychological horror experience, is releasing on PlayStation 5 on January 20.

items.title: Rainbow Six Siege Y10S4.2 Patch Deploys January 20
items.summary: Ubisoft releases patch notes for Rainbow Six Siege Year 10 Season 4.2 on January 20, including buffs to Thorn, Mozzie (adding Super Shorty shotgun), and Echo (increasing Yokai drones to 3), plus bug fixes.

items.title: Xbox, PlayStation, and Nintendo Reaffirm Player Safety Commitment
items.summary: Xbox President Sarah Bond announces an updated cross-platform safety framework with PlayStation and Nintendo, evolving the 2020 agreement to enhance inclusivity and address online risks.

items.title: Nintendo of America President Devon Pritchard Debuts at NY Game Awards
items.summary: New Nintendo of America president Devon Pritchard, succeeding retired Doug Bowser, introduces herself via video at The New York Game Awards, sparking fan discussions on her leadership.

items.title: Strategos Enters Early Access on PC Today
items.summary: Strategic war game Strategos, allowing simulation of large-scale battles, launches in early access on PC on January 20.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Canadian Government Invests $90M in Mangrove Lithium's Cleantech for Battery-Grade Lithium Production
items.summary: The federal government is providing up to US$65 million to Mangrove Lithium in Delta, Canada, to advance electrochemical technology for producing battery-grade lithium with lower waste and carbon footprint. The funding supports a larger commercial facility to produce lithium hydroxide for 500,000 electric vehicles annually.

items.title: European Trenchless Rehabilitation Technology Companies Announce Strategic Partnership
items.summary: Leading European firms in trenchless rehab technology have joined forces to enhance innovation and market presence in underground infrastructure solutions.
